text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Coverage 0..*CoverageInsurance or medical plan or a payment agreement
meta 0..1ProcessMetaMetadata about a resource
contained 0..0
Slices for extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
snapshotAgeInMonths 0..1unsignedIntAge in months at the time of the coverage period
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/snapshot-age-in-months
snapshotAgeInYears 0..1unsignedIntThe age of the person in years for the month of eligibility or service
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/snapshot-age-in-years
employeeSnapshotAgeInYears 0..1unsignedIntThe age of the employee in years for the month of eligibility or service
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-snapshot-age-in-years
ageGroup 0..1CodeableConceptStandard code for age groupings
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/age-group
Binding: Age Group Value Set (extensible)
ageGenderGroup 0..1CodeableConceptStandard code for groupings that combine age and gender
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/age-gender-group
Binding: Age and Gender Group Value Set (extensible)
attributedProviderReferenceWithPeriod 0..1Reference()Attributed provider reference with period
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/attributed-provider-with-period
benefitStatus 0..1CodeableConceptHIPAA standard code for the benefit status
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/benefit-status
valueCodeableConcept 0..1CodeableConceptValue of extension
Binding: HIPAA Benefit Status Value Set (extensible)
claimGroupIdentifier 0..1stringGroup ID of the plan member
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/claim-group-identifier
cobraIndicator 0..1stringIndicator of Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act (COBRA) continuation for the person
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/cobra-indicator
coverageDays 0..1unsignedIntNumber of covered days of eligibility
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/coverage-days
coverageMonth 0..1dateDate which reflects the month of eligibility
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/coverage-month
coverageInsurancePlan 0..1Reference(InsurancePlan)Reference to the insurance plan for this coverage
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/coverage-insurance-plan
dualEligibilityIndicator 0..1stringIndicator of dual eligibility for the Medicaid market
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/dual-eligibility-indicator
enrollmentPcp 0..1stringProvider identifier of the primary care physician for the plan member
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/enrollment-pcp
enrollmentPcpNameOnEnrollment 0..1stringOriginal primary care physician (PCP) name as reporting on the eligibility record
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/enrollment-pcp-name-on-enrollment
enrollmentPcpZipOnEnrollment 0..1stringOriginal primary care physician (PCP) zip as reporting on the eligibility record
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/enrollment-pcp-zip-on-enrollment
employeeAverageScheduledHours 0..1decimalAverage number of hours the employee is scheduled to work per day
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-average-scheduled-hours
employeeBirthDate 0..1dateBirthdate of the employee or contract holder
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-birth-date
employeeCompany 0..1CodeableConceptCode for the company of the employee
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-company
employeeCostCenter 0..1CodeableConceptCode for the cost center of the employee
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-cost-center
employeeCount 0..1unsignedIntFlag of the employees in the eligibility record
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-count
employeeBusinessUnit 0..1CodeableConceptCode for the business unit of the employee
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-business-unit
employeeDepartment 0..1CodeableConceptCode for the department of the employee
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-department
employeeDivision 0..1CodeableConceptCode for the division of the employee
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-division
employeeExemptIndicator 0..1stringIndicator of whether the employee status is exempt or non-exempt
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-exempt-indicator
employeeFamilySize 0..1integerTotal family size of the employee, whether or not dependents are insured or participating in any programs
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-family-size
employeeFTECount 0..1decimalFull Time Equivalent calculation for the employee
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-fte-count
employeeId 0..*IdentifierIdentifier for the employee
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-id
employeeJobFamily 0..1CodeableConceptCode for the job family of the employee
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-job-family
employeeJobGrade 0..1CodeableConceptCode for the job grade of the employee
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-job-grade
employeeJobLocation 0..*CodeableConceptCode for the physical location where the employee works
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-job-location
employeePayFrequency 0..1CodeableConceptCode indicating the frequency with which the employee is paid (e.g., daily, weekly, monthly)
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-pay-frequency
employeePerformanceRating 0..1CodeableConceptCode indicating the performance rating of the employee, assigned as of the last review period
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-performance-rating
employeeShift 0..1CodeableConceptCode indicating the regular shift which the employee is scheduled to work
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-shift
employeeSubBusinessUnit 0..1CodeableConceptCode of the sub business unit of the employee
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-sub-business-unit
salaryIndicator 0..1stringIndicator of whether the employee status is salaried
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/salary-indicator
unionWorkerIndicator 0..1stringIndicator that the contract holder (subscriber) belongs to a union
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/union-worker-indicator
employeeEducationLevel 0..1CodeableConceptCode indicating the highest level of education that the employee has completed
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-education-level
valueCodeableConcept 0..1CodeableConceptValue of extension
Binding: Health Data Connect Education Level Value Set (extensible)
employeeGender 0..1CodeableConceptEmployee gender code
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-gender
valueCodeableConcept 0..1CodeableConceptValue of extension
Binding: Health Data Connect Gender Value Set (extensible)
employeeHireDate 0..*dateFirst date of employment for the employee
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-hire-date
employeeTerminationDate 0..*dateLast date of employment for the employee
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-termination-date
employeeTerminationReason 0..*CodeableConceptCode indicating the reason for employee termination
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-termination-reason
employeeJobTitle 0..1CodeableConceptJob title of the employee
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-job-title
valueCodeableConcept 0..1CodeableConceptValue of extension
Binding: Health Data Connect Job Title Value Set (extensible)
employeeLaborUnion 0..1CodeableConceptCode for the labor union of the employee
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-labor-union
employeeRetirementDate 0..1dateDate of retirement for the employee or contract holder
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-retirement-date
employeeStatus 0..1CodeableConceptStatus of the employee based on one or more code systems
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-status
employeeUnionId 0..1stringIdentification for the labor union member
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-union-id
employeeWageAmount 0..1decimalWage amount of the employee for the time period represented by the Wage Basis field
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-wage-amount
employeeWageBasis 0..1CodeableConceptCode indicating the basis on which the wages of the employee are calculated
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-wage-basis
employeeYearOfService 0..1unsignedIntNet credited service in years for the employee
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employee-year-of-service
employer 0..1CodeableConceptCode for the employer
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/employer
familyIncomeLevel 0..1CodeableConceptCode for the family income level of the person based on the Federal Poverty Level (FPL)
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/family-income-level
jobClassCode 0..1CodeableConceptClassifcation group of the job role of the employee, for example, Top Executives, Post-secondary teachers, and Engineers
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/job-class-code
jobLocationZipcode 0..1string5-digit zip code of the facility where the employee works
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/job-location-zipcode
longTermDisabilityBenefitRate 0..1decimalLong term disability (LTD) benefit rate, expressed as a percentage of base wages (for example, 50.00%, 60.00%, 70.00%)
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/long-term-disability-benefit-rate
medicareCoverage 0..1CodeableConceptStandard code for the type of Medicare coverage, if any, for the person
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/medicare-coverage
valueCodeableConcept 0..1CodeableConceptValue of extension
Binding: Health Data Connect Medicare Coverage Value Set (extensible)
medicareIndicator 0..1stringIndicator of Medicare coverage for the member
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/medicare-indicator
memberEmployeeIndicator 0..1CodeableConceptCode indicates whether the member is either an employee of the health plan, or the dependent of an employee of the health plan
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/member-employee-indicator
planEmployeeCode 0..1stringCode indicating whether the member is an employee of the health plan or the dependent of an employee of the health plan
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/plan-employee-code
regionCode 0..1CodeableConceptCustomer-specific code for the geographic region of the employee
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/region-code
restrictedBenefits 0..1CodeableConceptCode of the scope of Medicaid or CHIP benefits for a person
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/restricted-benefits
shortTermDisabilityBenefitRate 0..1decimalShort term disability (STD) benefit rate, expressed as a percentage of base wages or benefit amount (for example, 50.00%, 60.00%, 70.00%)
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/short-term-disability-benefit-rate
ssiIndicator 0..1stringIndicates if the person receives Supplemental Security Income (SSI) administered via the Social Security Administration (SSA), at the time of coverage
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/ssi-indicator
ssiStatus 0..1CodeableConceptStandard code of the Supplemental Security Income (SSI) status for the person, at the time of coverage
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/ssi-status
valueCodeableConcept 0..1CodeableConceptValue of extension
Binding: Health Data Connect SSI Status Value Set (extensible)
tanfBenefits 0..1CodeableConceptStandard code of the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) benefits for the person
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/tanf-benefits
valueCodeableConcept 0..1CodeableConceptValue of extension
Binding: Health Data Connect TANF Benefit Value Set (extensible)
totalDependentCount 0..1integerNumber of dependents covered by the group health medical plan
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/total-dependent-count
subscriberIdEncrypted 0..1stringEncrypted identifier of the subscriber or family
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/subscriberId-encrypted
whPayerRecordPopulationCount 0..1integerSpecifies whether the member should be counted as eligible for the coverage period
URL: http://ibm.com/fhir/cdm/StructureDefinition/wh-payer-record-population-count
identifier 0..*CDMIdentifierAn identifier intended for computation
period 1..1PeriodCoverage start and end dates
payor 1..1Reference(Organization | Patient | RelatedPerson)Issuer of the policy
class
type 1..1CodeableConceptType of class such as 'group' or 'plan'
Binding: Health Data Connect Coverage Class Value Set (extensible)

Documentation for this format

name: CDMCoverage
title: CDM Coverage
description: Describes the healthcare benefit coverage of a member as it relates to a health plan. Coverage determines how the health care products and services the member receives may be paid. The CDMCoverage profile extends the base FHIR Coverage resource with additional benefit coverage details.

element.short: Insurance or medical plan or a payment agreement
element.definition: Financial instrument which may be used to reimburse or pay for health care products and services. Includes both insurance and self-payment.
element.comment: The Coverage resource contains the insurance card level information, which is customary to provide on claims and other communications between providers and insurers.

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()
constraint.xpath: not(exists(for $id in f:contained/*/f:id/@value return $contained[not(parent::*/descendant::f:reference/@value=concat('#', $contained/*/id/@value) or descendant::f:reference[@value='#'])]))

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management

element.short: Logical id of this artifact
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.short: Metadata about a resource
element.definition: The metadata about a resource. This is content in the resource that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.short: Language of the resource content
element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Contained, inline Resources
element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

element.definition: An Extension

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.short: Value of extension
element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html) for a list).

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the resource that contains them

element.short: An identifier intended for computation
element.definition: An identifier - identifies some entity uniquely and unambiguously. Typically this is used for business identifiers.
element.comment: The main (and possibly only) identifier for the coverage - often referred to as a Member Id, Certificate number, Personal Health Number or Case ID. May be constructed as the concatenation of the Coverage.SubscriberID and the Coverage.dependant.
element.requirements: Allows coverages to be distinguished and referenced.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: CX / EI (occasionally, more often EI maps to a resource id or a URL)
II - The Identifier class is a little looser than the v3 type II because it allows URIs as well as registered OIDs or GUIDs.  Also maps to Role[classCode=IDENT]

element.short: active | cancelled | draft | entered-in-error
element.definition: The status of the resource instance.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the code entered-in-error that marks the coverage as not currently valid.
element.requirements: Need to track the status of the resource as 'draft' resources may undergo further edits while 'active' resources are immutable and may only have their status changed to 'cancelled'.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labelled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource should not be treated as valid

binding.description: A code specifying the state of the resource instance.

element.short: Coverage category such as medical or accident
element.definition: The type of coverage: social program, medical plan, accident coverage (workers compensation, auto), group health or payment by an individual or organization.
element.requirements: The order of application of coverages is dependent on the types of coverage.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The type of insurance: public health, worker compensation; private accident, auto, private health, etc.) or a direct payment by an individual or organization.

element.short: Owner of the policy
element.definition: The party who 'owns' the insurance policy.
element.comment: For example: may be an individual, corporation or the subscriber's employer.
element.requirements: This provides employer information in the case of Worker's Compensation and other policies.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: IN1-16, 18,  19-name of insured, address, date of birth

element.short: Subscriber to the policy
element.definition: The party who has signed-up for or 'owns' the contractual relationship to the policy or to whom the benefit of the policy for services rendered to them or their family is due.
element.comment: May be self or a parent in the case of dependants.
element.requirements: This is the party who is entitled to the benfits under the policy.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: IN1-16, 18,  19-name of insured, address, date of birth

element.short: ID assigned to the subscriber
element.definition: The insurer assigned ID for the Subscriber.
element.requirements: The insurer requires this identifier on correspondance and claims (digital and otherwise).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: IN1-16, 18,  19-name of insured, address, date of birth

element.short: Plan beneficiary
element.definition: The party who benefits from the insurance coverage; the patient when products and/or services are provided.
element.requirements: This is the party who receives treatment for which the costs are reimbursed under the coverage.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: IN1-16, 18,  19-name of insured, address, date of birth

element.short: Dependent number
element.definition: A unique identifier for a dependent under the coverage.
element.comment: Periodically the member number is constructed from the subscriberId and the dependant number.
element.requirements: For some coverages a single identifier is issued to the Subscriber and then a unique dependent number is issued to each beneficiary.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: - No exact HL7 v2 equivalent concept seems to exist;

element.short: Beneficiary relationship to the subscriber
element.definition: The relationship of beneficiary (patient) to the subscriber.
element.comment: Typically, an individual uses policies which are theirs (relationship='self') before policies owned by others.
element.requirements: To determine relationship between the patient and the subscriber to determine coordination of benefits.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The relationship between the Subscriber and the Beneficiary (insured/covered party/patient).

element.short: Coverage start and end dates
element.definition: Time period during which the coverage is in force. A missing start date indicates the start date isn't known, a missing end date means the coverage is continuing to be in force.
element.requirements: Some insurers require the submission of the coverage term.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Issuer of the policy
element.definition: The program or plan underwriter or payor including both insurance and non-insurance agreements, such as patient-pay agreements.
element.comment:
May provide multiple identifiers such as insurance company identifier or business identifier (BIN number).
For selfpay it may provide multiple paying persons and/or organizations.
element.requirements: Need to identify the issuer to target for claim processing and for coordination of benefit processing.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Additional coverage classifications
element.definition: A suite of underwriter specific classifiers.
element.comment: For example may be used to identify a class of coverage or employer group, Policy, Plan.
element.requirements: The codes provided on the health card which identify or confirm the specific policy for the insurer.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: Type of class such as 'group' or 'plan'
element.definition: The type of classification for which an insurer-specific class label or number and optional name is provided, for example may be used to identify a class of coverage or employer group, Policy, Plan.
element.requirements: The insurer issued label for a specific health card value.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Value associated with the type
element.definition: The alphanumeric string value associated with the insurer issued label.
element.comment: For example, the Group or Plan number.
element.requirements: The insurer issued label and value are necessary to identify the specific policy.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Human readable description of the type and value
element.definition: A short description for the class.
element.requirements: Used to provide a meaningful description in correspondence to the patient.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Relative order of the coverage
element.definition: The order of applicability of this coverage relative to other coverages which are currently in force. Note, there may be gaps in the numbering and this does not imply primary, secondary etc. as the specific positioning of coverages depends upon the episode of care.
element.requirements: Used in managing the coordination of benefits.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: - No exact HL7 v2 equivalent concept seems to exist;

element.short: Insurer network
element.definition: The insurer-specific identifier for the insurer-defined network of providers to which the beneficiary may seek treatment which will be covered at the 'in-network' rate, otherwise 'out of network' terms and conditions apply.
element.requirements: Used in referral for treatment and in claims processing.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Patient payments for services/products
element.definition: A suite of codes indicating the cost category and associated amount which have been detailed in the policy and may have been  included on the health card.
element.comment: For example by knowing the patient visit co-pay, the provider can collect the amount prior to undertaking treatment.
element.requirements: Required by providers to manage financial transaction with the patient.

element.short: Cost category
element.definition: The category of patient centric costs associated with treatment.
element.comment: For example visit, specialist visits, emergency, inpatient care, etc.
element.requirements: Needed to identify the category associated with the amount for the patient.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The types of services to which patient copayments are specified.

element.short: The amount or percentage due from the beneficiary
element.definition: The amount due from the patient for the cost category.
element.comment: Amount may be expressed as a percentage of the service/product cost or a fixed amount of currency.
element.requirements: Needed to identify the amount for the patient associated with the category.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Exceptions for patient payments
element.definition: A suite of codes indicating exceptions or reductions to patient costs and their effective periods.
element.requirements: Required by providers to manage financial transaction with the patient.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: Exception category
element.definition: The code for the specific exception.
element.requirements: Needed to identify the exception associated with the amount for the patient.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The types of exceptions from the part or full value of financial obligations such as copays.

element.short: The effective period of the exception
element.definition: The timeframe during when the exception is in force.
element.requirements: Needed to identify the applicable timeframe for the exception for the correct calculation of patient costs.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Reimbursement to insurer
element.definition: When 'subrogation=true' this insurance instance has been included not for adjudication but to provide insurers with the details to recover costs.
element.comment: Typically, automotive and worker's compensation policies would be flagged with 'subrogation=true' to enable healthcare payors to collect against accident claims.
element.requirements: See definition for when to be used.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Contract details
element.definition: The policy(s) which constitute this insurance coverage.
element.requirements: To reference the legally binding contract between the policy holder and the insurer.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Full Time Equivalent calculation for the employee. Example 1: A full-time employee would have a value of 1. Example 2: A 20-hour per week employee would have a value of 0.5.
